title: What if more Marksman had ammo?
body:
I noticed people often mention Jhin and Graves as being some of the most fun marksmen, as their Ammo systems give them greater depth and allow their kit and basic attacks to have more power and utility. I also noticed people love playing Ezreal, the marksman who mainly uses spell casts to boost his damage. Even passives like Lucian's are good because he doesn't get his full DPS without using abilities correctly.

What if we made more Marksmen have some form of reload/ammo/resource system for their primary attacks? Would people like this, yay or nay? It surely would make Marksmen less right clicky. And in return would give them more power budget.

It needs to stay a niche mechanic. Having limited ability to auto-attack as a marksman forces Riot to load more power into the kit elsewhere. We don't need more overloaded kits in League.

The choices with champions tend to be overloaded or linear.

With Marksmen you must ask yourself if you would prefer them right clicking you to death from 600 units. Or actively doing something you can play around.

I disagree. There's a balance that can be made and keep things healthy and interesting. 

Like, I feel like Cait's kit is a decent design (trying to leave tuning out of this). She can sit back and right click, but it's not going to be her maximum damage potential. If she wants to maximize damage, she'd basically need a trap > auto > net > auto combo (maybe even add Q > R to the end of that as the target is running away, to complete the full combo). But her trap requires either the opponent to misstep and run into it, or other CC from an allied source which lets her put the trap under the target so they're caught once the other CC is over. On top of that, if she wants to use the net - auto combo, it forces her to use her only escape on a long-ish cooldown to get that last long-range auto in. There are choices forced by both cait and her opponent in allowing her to use her max damage combo. This is healthy design.

On the other hand, to compensate for the ammo system on Jhin, they gave him a ton of utility. His crits give a significant amount of movespeed. This is guaranteed to be available when he lands his 4th shot and needs to reload, so it's not even that easy to take advantage of his short period of vulnerability while reloading. His kind of ammo system should have the tradeoff of poor waveclear. But he can almost instantly wipe out huge waves of minions with his traps alone. Then there's the long-range ult with the massive slow on any target he manages to tag. Why on earth does it need to have an 80% slow? The ult is simultaneously an execute mechanic and has insane utility. The execute portion makes it feel like it's something he should be using later in a fight when things are already low or held in place by allies. But the slow on it makes it just as good for creating a pick or initiating a team fight. In LCS you see it used more for the slow and deterring the opponents from a push or an objective than you do for actually securing kills. All this together makes for a really cool design and he has a lot of versatility, but I do not believe it's actually a healthy design, regardless of tuning. 

I do not believe that moving every champion to overloaded kits because they're more interesting is a direction that's good for the game.

But here's the thing: The way things are right now, marksmen are always in a state of "3-4 of us are super good. The rest fucking suck." This happened last year. It's happening this year. It happened in season 5. It keeps happening. Marksmen have too little counter-play in a game where we value that core concept. Having ammo on more marksmen that work in different ways and offer power and weaknesses in different ways will open up the role to having more relevant marksmen at one time.

That's poor/lazy balance. General power levels of champions can be tuned. AD items can be tuned and modified. Defensive options against marksmen can be modified (likely will be in the pending tank rework). And we know they're already looking to overhaul the masteries again.

The overabundance of overloaded champions shouldn't be used as justification to overload everybody else. That's just going to make the game harder to balance and make the outliers even worse when they do crop up.

How many times are they going to tune marksmen for the same result?

X is too strong. We're shaving some ad and nerfing some mana costs.

Y is too weak. We're buffing some scalings and giving them some cd buffs.

Result? X is now forgotten and Y is extra powerful for 2-3 months. Next time it'll just flip and Y will leave the stage for Z or X. The problem is that there isn't enough levers to balance the traditional marksman around. They ALL do the same thing. You know something's wrong when marksmen are balanced around when they're strong and not what they do to be strong.

You're chasing unicorns. No matter what changes they make, there are going to be some champs who pop up as best for their role. They'll remain that way until the game shifts yet again, and we'll move onto something else. It's a natural filtering that's going to happen no matter what as players try to continually seek what's optimal. The real question is how to make those outliers closer to the average champ power level.

The problem with all the champion diversifying that they're doing is that they're pushing champion strengths higher than they've ever been. They've also diversified the items and masteries, so there's always going to be some build path that trumps other build paths. The champs whose strengths best abuse the strongest items and masteries at the time are going to stick out as the outliers. 

Adding even more complexity only makes this whole thing worse. If you want fewer outliers (or for those outliers to be closer to average than they currently are), then something needs simplified somewhere. You can't get there by adding more complexity.

I don't think every adc should get an ammo system, but I think a few others could benefit from it thematically and gameplay-wise. 

Jinx with a really large magazine and long reload so she has to balance between her machine gun, rocket launcher,  and abilities. Caitlyn with just one bullet that has really high impact. Maybe Corki, but I can't think of anything special for him. 

Draven could have just 2 axes, but he can "reload" by catching an ace - he could attack twice quickly, but can't attack again unless he catches an axe or does a short reload after he misses them. It could be pretty cool, his "reload" could be more axes dropping from the skies while an audience cheers.

Miss Fortune could have separate ammo for each gun. She attacks with whichever side is closest to the target, and each side has a separate interval between attacks ( if she shot with her right gun, it would be 1 second before she could shoot with that gun again, but her left gun can still shoot - but only at targets on her left. She would have to turn to get the original target in range.). Love Tap would proc each time a target was hit by a different gun (optimal damage and attack speed comes from alternating shots - left, right, left, right). She reloads only after both guns run out or her passive movespeed boost activates. She would have to position herself correctly and move the right way to maximize her attack speed and get her Love Tap off. And, if she shot just one gun too much, she could be left in a bad position.
